00001 Release Notes {#mainpage}
00002 ============
00003 
00004 [TOC]
00005 
00006 # Introduction {#Introduction}
00007 
00008 Welcome to Collage, a high-performance C++ library for developing
00009 object-oriented distributed applications. This release introduces the
00010 official 1.0 API of the former Equalizer network library.
00011 
00012 Collage 1.0 is a stable release of over eight years of development and
00013 decades of experience into a high-performance and mature C++ library. It
00014 is intended for all C++ developers creating distributed applications
00015 with high-level abstractions. Collage 1.0 can be retrieved by
00016 downloading the source code or one of the precompiled packages.
00017 
00018 ## Features {#Features}
00019 
00020 Collage provides different levels of abstraction to facilitate the
00021 development distributed applications:
00022 
00023 * Network Connections: stream-oriented point-to-point and reliable
00024   multicast connections for TCP/IP, SDP, InfiniBand RDMA, UDT, events,
00025   named and anonymous pipes, memory buffers and reliable multicast over
00026   UDP.
00027 * Peer-to-Peer Messaging: Endian-safe node-to-node message communication
00028   with thread-aware message dispatch.
00029 * Synchronization: Distributed barriers and synchronous messaging.
00030 * Object data distribution: high-performance, object-oriented, versioned
00031   data distribution for C++ objects based on delta serialization.
00032 
00033 # New in this release {#New}
00034 
00035 Collage 1.0 contains the following features, enhancements, bug fixes and
00036 documentation changes over the Equalizer 1.4 release:
00037 
00038 ## New Features {#NewFeatures}
00039 
00040 * Endian-safe messaging
00041 * RDMA connection supported on Windows
00042 
00043 ## Enhancements {#Enhancements}
00044 
00045 * Improved co::ObjectMap API and implementation
00046 
00047 ## Optimizations {#Optimizations}
00048 
00049 * co::WorkerThread uses bulk message retrieval from co::CommandQueue
00050 
00051 ## Tools {#Tools}
00052 
00053 * New coNodePerf application to benchmark node-to-node messaging performance
00054 
00055 ## Documentation {#Documentation}
00056 
00057 The following documentation has been added or substantially improved
00058 since the last release:
00059 
00060 * Full documentation for the public Collage API
00061 * Expanded Collage content in the Equalizer Programming and User Guide
00062 
00063 ## Bug Fixes {#Fixes}
00064 
00065 Collage 1.0 includes various bugfixes over the Equalizer 1.4 release,
00066 including the following:
00067 
00068 * [25](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/25): mapObject races
00069   with commit
00070 * [22](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/22): Crash during
00071   concurrent object deregister and map
00072 * [13](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/13): Global argument
00073   parsing broken
00074 * [3](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/3): Snappy compressor
00075   does not work on PPC
00076 
00077 ## Known Bugs {#Bugs}
00078 
00079 The following bugs were known at release time. Please file a [Bug Report](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues) if you find any other issue with this release.
00080 
00081 * [16](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/16): RSP Interface not
00082   bound on Linux
00083 * [15](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/15): RDMAConnection
00084   not endian-safe
00085 * [14](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/14): coNetperf server
00086   occasionally crashes on client disconnect
00087 * [2](https://github.com/Eyescale/Collage/issues/2): Multiple dispatcher
00088   inheritance not working with xlC
00089 
00090 # About {#About}
00091 
00092 Collage is a cross-platform library, designed to run on any modern
00093 operating system, including all Unix variants and the Windows operating
00094 system. Collage uses CMake and
00095 [Buildyard](https://github.com/Eyescale/Buildyard) to create a
00096 platform-specific build environment. The following platforms and build
00097 environments are tested for version 1.0:
00098 
00099 * Linux: Ubuntu 12.04, 12.10, 13.04, RHEL 6.3 (Makefile, i386, x64)
00100 * Windows: 7 (Visual Studio 2008, i386, x64)
00101 * Mac OS X: 10.8 (Makefile, XCode, i386, x64)
00102 
00103 The Equalizer Programming and User Guide covers the basics of Collage
00104 programming. The API documentation can be found on
00105 [github](http://eyescale.github.io/).
00106 
00107 As with any open source project, the available source code, in
00108 particular the shipped tools provide a reference for developing or
00109 porting applications.
00110 
00111 Technical questions can be posted to the eq-dev Mailing List, or
00112 directly to info@equalizergraphics.com.
00113 
00114 Commercial support, custom software development and porting services are
00115 available from [Eyescale](http://www.eyescale.ch). Please contact
00116 [info@eyescale.ch](mailto:info@eyescale.ch?subject=Collage%20support)
00117 for further information.
00118
